overview: Uri Sarid leads the engineering team at Loyalize, from technology strategy and implementation to delivered products and services. Uri brings an extensive record of hands-on software engineering leadership to Loyalize. As VP of Engineering at eMeter , he led the technical team to deliver industry-leading software and solutions for the Smart Grid. Previously, he was the CTO and VP of Engineering at Aptana, building and launching Aptana Studio (the leading IDE for Ajax developers), Jaxer (the world’s first Ajax server), and Aptana Cloud (web projects deployed to the cloud in 60 seconds). Uri was co-founder and CTO for Accomplice,, which offered a peer-to-peer, distributed task management solution for consumers and small businesses. Before Accomplice, he was CTO and VP Engineering at Noosh (now NewlineNoosh), which he came to via its acquisition of digiGroups, where he was co-founder and CEO. Uri is actively involved in the San Francisco Bay area technology community, founding BayJax, the Bay Area Ajax meetup. In his previous life, Uri was a physics faculty member at University of Notre Dame, a postdoctoral fellow at Lawrence Berkeley Lab and Stanford, and recevied his Ph.D. from Harvard University.
